Caption: Figure 1: Using TimeStitch to explore events surrounding smoking lapse and to build and compare cohorts of abstinent smokers. (a) Event sequences frequently performed by abstinent smokers, ending with smoking episodes. (b) Selecting the work→drive →smoke sequence defines a cohort (subset) of abstinent smokers that have this focal sequence, and yields a timeline of the common frequent event sequences before and after the focal sequence. (c) Top: cohort defined by two focal sequences; Center: top cohort cloned and modified, shown alongside one another vertically; Bottom: center cohort cloned and generalized to include more abstinent smokers by allowing two possible second focal sequences through an “OR” operation.
